name: places/ChIJH27EneL1wokRH-ccWqPuj0w
adrFormatAddress: 2336 2nd Ave #1, New York, NY 10035-4219, USA

originalText.text: Very welcoming environment. I went there couple of times for annual physicals. During my visits service was very quick. If you don't have appointment and ever experience that you're waiting for while as WALK-in, (which I've experienced once) please be patient as Dr. Christine takes time to holistically deliver the healthcare you need. Of course emergency is priority. Dr. Mosse is a very smart and experienced physician who really fits this neighborhood she's servicing. She is culturally and spiritually competent as she delivers care. Speaks English, Spanish, French, Creole... Give it a try! ðŸ˜Š

originalText.text: While I cannot speak to their medical proficiency I can most certainly say that their customer service is superb. Although they couldn't assist me with an echocardiogram, the lovely lady I spoke with over the phone was more than helpful in directing me to multiple paths I could take to secure an echo at little to no cost to myself. I wish more doctors offices were so helpful.

originalText.text:
Today is march 20, and i decided to walk in Dr.Moss medical office for a fast brief  "How you doing" visit as i worked with her for over 12 year at North General Hospital as a building service employ and she was also my primary doctor. For 2 years i couldn't do any follow up"s due to no insurance coverage because NGH file for bankruptcy and i was out of work, I'm currently in workers comp but they don"t pay for health insurance and pay nothing compare to a 9 to 5 job with health insurance. As i walked in and ask for her i gave the gentleman my name and ask if i could talk to Dr. moss, he mention that shes with a patient.

I sat down and waited 8 min and went back to the Germain and ask him that i wanna see if she could take my blood pressure which takes 2 min out of her time because i did not feel well and felt it was high blood pressure because i was weak, dizzy and with a hedic. He reply and said she can't do that because i need to get seen and enter into a room for a full check up. I asked him if he could go and ask her if is possible and for him to give her my full name which she know me and my family very well. I figure it wouldn't be a big deal. oh boy, i was i wrong!!! I heard her clearly say "she can't do that and that i need to go to metropolitan because it's been too long"  now i understand she wants to get pay but for an old co-worker and knowing my family not to mention i had offer her to stripe and wax her office floors for nothing in return was kinda shocking to me.

She didn't even come her self to just say hi and make me understand that she can't do such thing. I would've appreciate that more then just brushing me away like that. I'm from the neighborhood in fact i live right down the street from her medical office and when i felt the way i did i figure i could run in there for a 2 min help but no help was given. I left her office and seen a Friend of mine and he stopped me to talk so i was telling him my experience that just happen and he told me that he used to go there but he stopped because she was rude, Know i cant agree with him because i never seen that part of her but thinking about what just happen today i have to agree.

Anyways, he told me to go to rite aid on 118 street on 3rd ave because they have a free blood pressure machine. Wow, "free" and to say i never enter rite aid to purchase anything before i felt like I'm using them mind you Dr.moss was my doctor and was getting paid from my insurance at the time. What ever happen to taking care of the neighborhood when in need? She knows i live in the poor ghetto and she knows that people around here don't have coverage but she's smart to open a medical office around this neighborhood due to cheap rent and tax exempt. I will be seeking another doctor and i was right, i had high blood pressure 163 over 88. THANK YOU DR.MOSS I JUST CAME OUT OF THE HOSPITAL THANKS TO RITE AID FOR THEY FREE 1 MINUTE SERVICE!!!

originalText.text: Although the wait is sometimes long, Dr. Mosse is worth it.  Caring and attentive. Love her.
